1860/A0/05/003/001.indicator_name: Existencia de estándares de calidad por educación pre-básica y educación básica

1860/A0/05/003/001.status_value: No education establishments were certified in 2013. Technical assistance will be provided in 2014 to MoE for designing a plan and strategy to certify those schools that implement the standards
1860/A0/05/003/001.indicator_name: Porcentaje de centros certificados que implementan estándares de calidad culturalmente pertinente

1860/A0/05/008/001.status_value: 5 out of 7 indicators are on track
1860/A0/05/008/001.indicator_name: El programa cuenta con la capacidad humana adecuada para poder realizar el seguimiento que requiere

1860/A0/05/002/006.status_value: The first National Commission for Early Childhood has been officially created promoting an inter institutional and inter sectorial approach to work at the national  departmental and municipal levels  allowing the definition of norms and quality standards for early childhood care linked to a comprehensive early childhood care route.
1860/A0/05/002/006.indicator_name: Norms and quality standards developed for early childhood services and programmes
1860/A0/05/002/006.headline: Capacities of two Inter-Institutional Commissions in the Departments of Lempira and Intibucá and 28 Inter-Institutional Municipal Commissions have been developed. The Municipal Commissions associated in mancomunidades have created ECD work plans which include inter-institutional coordination mechanisms  and community interventions in ECD.

1860/A0/05/002/006.status_value: The comprehensive route for early childhood care was designed and validated by six sectors at the central level  local level actors and UN agencies working on the issue. Costing of the route will be carried out in 2017
1860/A0/05/002/006.indicator_name: Comprehensive early childhood care route designed and its cost estimated based on a local pilot experience
1860/A0/05/002/006.headline: Capacities of two Inter-Institutional Commissions in the Departments of Lempira and Intibucá and 28 Inter-Institutional Municipal Commissions have been developed. The Municipal Commissions associated in mancomunidades have created ECD work plans which include inter-institutional coordination mechanisms  and community interventions in ECD.

1860/A0/05/002/006.status_value: A conceptual framework of indicators has been designed to give a follow up on the implementation of the early chilhodd policy and on the other hand will also allow the monitoring of a comprehensive care for each child. Basic information was collected at the community level in 28 municipalities through an LQAS methodology
1860/A0/05/002/006.indicator_name: RENPI has developed and is using a system of indicators for monitoring early childhood development in priority departments.
1860/A0/05/002/006.headline: Capacities of two Inter-Institutional Commissions in the Departments of Lempira and Intibucá and 28 Inter-Institutional Municipal Commissions have been developed. The Municipal Commissions associated in mancomunidades have created ECD work plans which include inter-institutional coordination mechanisms  and community interventions in ECD.

1860/A0/05/002/005.indicator_name: Percentage of municipalities in priority departments (n=45) where a community care model for promoting comprehensive child development is being implemented
1860/A0/05/002/005.headline: Te government prioritized 17 services and established a plan for gradual implementation  based on existing national standards to support the integrated development of children aged 0 to 6 years. The process of piloting has begun in two municipalities and will scale up starting 2017

1860/A0/05/002/003.indicator_name: Percentage of hospitals in priorty departments which receive support for the establsihment of birth registration offices
1860/A0/05/002/003.headline: The National Registry of Persons increased its capacity for ensuring timely registration of births. Currently it has 343 registration offices. A total of 293 civil registration offices use digital platforms. The national average for birth registration before the child's first birthday is 96 per cent.
